title: [K-12] Practice-Centered Online Workshop for Strengthening Language Education Technology Expertise: Integrated Text, Vocabulary, and Communication Design

context.prior_knowledge: Experience in educational technology theories or language education (understanding grammatical structures, text analysis skills, basic vocabulary acquisition, digital tool utilization)
context.additional_context: A smartphone-based learning environment with online tools for project collaboration. Ensures accessibility to digital resources specialized for language education design (Quizlet, Google Classroom, etc.). Utilizes multimedia materials (podcasts, infographics) to improve learners' reading comprehension and writing skills.

learning_goals: Learners can master over 80% of core competencies for educational technology specialists (instructional design, project management, language learning theory application) and particularly understand grammar structure analysis and learner-customized vocabulary expansion strategies.

Learners can analyze two or more stakeholder collaboration scenarios, propose practical applications for language education, and integrate text-based activity design with communication skill enhancement strategies (including role-play/debate activities).

Learners can plan a 3â€“5 session language education project reflecting 21st-century skills (critical thinking, digital literacy), use Canva or Padlet to produce one lesson design document and two activity materials (e.g., digital posters, collaboration boards). Outputs must achieve an average of 4.0+ on peer evaluations (5-point scale), meet 80%+ of teacher feedback rubric criteria, and include text-based activity design, vocabulary expansion strategies (5+ items), and communication skill enhancement (role-play/debate activities).

resources: ETCS (European Transfer and Accumulation System) survey tool template
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
